page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: OUR COUNTRSIDE HAS A GENTLE BEAUTY: SOFTLY ROLLING HILLS, A SMALL MEANDERING RIVER, QUIET SIDE-ROADS AND ONE BUSY HIGHWAY, THE A701, LINKING THE HAMLETS OF ROMANNO BRIDGE AND BLYTH BRIDGE, AS IT RUNS FROM EDINBURGH TO MOFFAT. ON EITHER SIDE LIE FIELDS GRAZED BY CATTLE OR SHEEP OR PRODUCING FODDER. THE FARMS ARE WELL ESTABLISHED AND ONE IS A FARMING RESEARCH STATION. THERE ARE TRACES OF ROMAN AND PRE-ROMAN SETTLEMENTS AND OLD DROVE ROADS. THERE ARE LEGENDS OF DISPUTING MONKS AND WARRING GYPSIES. THE RAILWAY CAME AND WENT AS DID WAR-TIME EVACUEES. NOW OUR CHURCHS AND SCHOOLS HAVE AMALGAMATED. MANY PEOPLE TRAVEL TO WORK IN EDINBURGH BUT ENJOY LIVING IN THIS HAPPY RURAL COMMUNITY.
